name: Special Occasion Baked Stuffed Lobster
author: Pam
summary: Celebrate in style! Anniversaries, New Year's Eve, Valentine's Day all call for a special entree, and this is sure to win over that special someone. The great part of this recipe is that the lobster is partially boiled so that the prep is a little easier. Provide additional butter for dipping if desired. Serve with a salad, a baguette, and a nice wine, and enjoy this romantic dinner for two!
ingredients: 1 sleeve buttery round crackers (such as Ritz®), crushed
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Fill a large pot with 2 inches of water and bring to a boil
Submerge lobsters head-first into the boiling water; cover and steam until bright red, about 15 minutes
Remove from the pot and submerge in cold water
Heat 2 tablespoons butter in a skillet over medium heat
Cook and stir until shallot is tender and scallops are partially cooked, about 3 minutes
Fold in cracker crumbs and parsley to make a loose stuffing
Place lobsters on a work surface
Split underside of body with kitchen scissors
Remove tomalley (liver), roe (eggs), sac (behind eyes), and intestinal vein
Split tail open and bend shell back underneath to lie flat to make ample room for stuffing
Place lobsters in a jelly roll pan with backs facing down
Baste with the about 3 tablespoons melted butter, including the shell area
Stuff body cavities and tails with filling
Drizzle the remaining butter over all
Bake in the preheated oven until filling is golden brown, about 20 minutes
